meanings.definition: A loud cry or shout used as a signal or warning.
meanings.sent1: The watchcry of the captain alerted the crew to the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers' watchcry echoed through the battlefield, urging them to stand firm.
meanings.sent3: The watchcry of the squirrel startled the cat, causing it to jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her watchcry pierced the silence of the night, a beacon of alarm for those in danger.
meanings.sent5: The watchcry of the lifeguard saved the drowning swimmer from peril.

meanings.definition: A slogan or rallying cry used to unite a group.
meanings.sent1: The political party's watchcry of 'Unity in Diversity' resonated with the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The team's watchcry before the match motivated them to play with determination.
meanings.sent3: The watchcry of 'One for all, all for one' brought a smile to everyone's face.
meanings.sent4: Her watchcry of 'Together we stand, divided we fall' inspired unity among the group.
meanings.sent5: The watchcry of 'Strength in unity' became the motto of the community.

meanings.definition: To shout or cry out loudly as a signal or warning.
meanings.sent1: She had to watchcry for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The coach would watchcry instructions to the players during the intense match.
meanings.sent3: He would watchcry his excitement whenever his favorite team scored a goal.
meanings.sent4: The mother watchcried for her child to come back as they wandered off in the store.
meanings.sent5: The hiker had to watchcry for assistance when he injured his ankle on the trail.
